reviewText: I recently bought the first two sets of The Royal Rumble because I love old WWF wrestling. I have the tape to this and its a good Rumble with a few clunker of matches but enjoyable overall. One thing I enjoyed about WWF at this point in time was how they created a storyline. They dragged it out over a period of months and they had a few matches in between and usually a great payoff match in the end.Triple H VS Goldust: A decent match with Triple H winning in a long one in his signature style.Ahmed Johnson VS Faarooq: I remember this feud but it wasnt my favorite feud. A decent match and I did like the aftermath.Vader VS Undertaker: A dream match that was did not live up to the hype.Fuerza Guerrera, Jerry Estrada & Heavy Metal VS El Canek, Perro Aguayo & Hector Garza: WWF tried to copy WCW with cruiserweights but Vince and WWF never have and never will get how to market cruiserweights. WWF had a contract with AAA(the Mexican wrestling league) but it did not last long. This was a good match.Royal Rumble: I highly enjoyed this Rumble. They threw in a few Mexican wrestlers-the legendary Mil Mascaras, Cibernetico, and Latin Lover. I hated how Mascaras was eliminated but the Rumble had plenty of action. I enjoyed the ending.Shawn Michaels VS Syscho Sid: I remeber this feud clearly. Micheals was the home town boy so that basically gives tells you who would win. A very good title match.Overall, one of the better Rumbles. It was nice to see all the Mexican wrestlers compete and Michaels winning the world title. I wish WWE would put the fatal fourway match that took place after this event. That was a hell of a main event and needs to see the light of day.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1997 VHS

reviewText: What a PPV! What a video!!! Austin's gonna win the Royal Rumble to headline WrestleMania XIII.Let's take a look...Intercontinental ChampionshipTriple H vs. GoldustGood opener but the match is way tooo loooooonnnnng.Nice moves by these to men to make this a decent match.Winner: Triple HRating: 6.5/10Ahmed Johnson vs. FaarooqA little bit better than the first one but this one is a short one.Average moves by these two menWinner: Ahmed JohnsonRating: 7/10Vader vs. UndertakerNot that good but it is still nicer than the two first matches.Big moves by these two men.An OK match.Winner: UndertakerRating: 7.5/10Fuerza Guerrera, Jerry Estrada & Heavy Metal vs. El Canek, Perro Aguayo & Hector GarzaA mexican style wrestling with amateur & old-fashioned style wrestling but they prove that they are really wrestlers.An amazing match.Winner: Fuerza Guerrera, Jerry Estrada & Heavy MetalRating: 9/1030 men Royal Rumble MatchThis is one of the most unserious royal rumble matches ever in the WWE.Some of this are when numbers 1-5, there is no clock to signal that the superstar is entering the ring.Another one when Bret Hart eliminated Steve Austin and Austin come back to the ring because of the fighting of Mankind and Terry Funk with the referee never saw.Winner: Steve AustinRating: 7.5/10WWF ChampionshipSycho Sid vs. Shawn MichaelsAn average championship match with some brutal moves by Sycho Sid to Shawn Michaels like Shawn Michaels hitting  Sycho Sid with a camera and a sick powerbomb on Shawn Michaels to the floor.That's a garbage championship match!Winner: Shawn MichaelsRating: 7/10An average DVD with some ugly matches like the first match in which Triple H wins the Intercontinental title.I promote this DVD to all of you especially to the customers.HEHEHEHE!!!
summary: Austin's second Royal Rumble Match and first time to win the Royal Rumble
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1997 VHS

reviewText: Now that I got 1996 out of the way I'm up to The WWF in 1997 of course I'm going to start off with The Royal Rumble. The show has been called a stadium that needed a show instead of show that needed a big dome stadium. The backstory leading into this show wasn't the best on The December 30th episode of RAW you had an in ring debate with Shawn Michaels & Bret Hart Sycho Sid inturrpted them & said that he wanted some real competition. That brought out The Undertaker then Big Van Vader jumped The Undertaker. Shawn Michaels then low blowed Bret & started fighting with Sid. The following week on RAW Sycho Sid said that he was going to apologize for what he was going to do. It resulted in Jose Lathero's son Pete being powerbombed on a table. On The December 23rd episode of RAW Jerry "The King" Lawler lost The Milton Bradley Karate Fighters Tournament to Sable. The King & Hunter Hearst Helmsley double teamed Marc Mero Goldust mad the save. The King asked Goldust if he was a qu  e  e  r Goldust said no & knocked him out. On The December 30th episode of RAW Hunter Hearst Helmsley  tried to take Marlena & carry her off Marc Mero tried to stop him Hunter threw Goldust & Marlena into Mero. On The January 16th episode of RAW during a match The Undertaker was having with Crush The Nation Of Domination & Vader beat down The Undertaker. Ahmed Johnson came down to make the save but he was out numbered & Faarooq used the 2 by 3 on Ahmed's kidney area. That is pretty much the backstory. The buyrate for this show was a 0.70 that is down from The Rumble from the year before which got a 1.10.The current champions at the time wereWWF Champion Sycho Sid November 17th 1996WWF Intercontenintal Champion Hunter Hearst Helmsley October 21st 1996WWF Tag Team Champions Owen Hart & The British Bulldog September 22nd 1996Date January 19, 1997Attendance 60,525Venue AlamodomeCity San Antonio, TexasFree For AllLa Parkita & SarTita Def Mini Vader & Mini Mankind * a rather poor matchTodd Pettingill interviewed the dumb a  s  ses from The Royal Rumble commercials their names are Adam & George. I don't know if I spelled the 2 Mexican Wrestlers names right but this was nothing to write home about.Todd Pettingill interviewed Shawn Michaels.Dok Hendrix went down the list of some of the names that will be in The Royal Rumble.Sunny came out took the mic from Dok.Sycho Sid came out he ranted on the mic & said he won't be responsible for his actions tonight.Then we get to The Pay Per View the opening was really good.WWF Intercontenintal ChampionshipChampion Hunter Hearst Helmsley with Mr Hughes Def Goldust with Marlena * & 3 quarters of a starMcMahon tells us that those 2 guys Adam & George were thrown out of the stadium for going into a restricted area. Now you had Goldust uses steel steps as a weapon right in front of The Referee so why isn't he disqualified. They go to the crowd where Todd Pettingill talks to Colin Raye. This match was ok but boring in spots.They show comments by different WWF superstars about being in The Royal Rumble.Ahmed Johnson Def Faarooq with The Nation Of Domination by disqualification * & quarter of a star Faarooq  uses a chair on Ahmed right in front of The Referee I don't remember this being a stipulation match. The Nation Of Domination interfered Ahmed fought them off he gave 1 of the members a Pearl River Plunge through The French Announcers Table. This match was bad considering that it was suppose to a big match.The show comments from Terry Funk about being in Royal RumbleTodd Pettingill interviews The Nation Of Domination Faarooq said that this is just the beginning & that he will go after Ahmed in The Rumble.Big Van Vader Def The Undertaker * & half stars during this match Todd Pettingill talks to a girl who likes to follow Shawn Michaels everywhere. She also saved her babysitting money to get to this show.This was yet another big match that wasn't any good considering you 2 of the best big men in pro wrestling this was a let down. When a match with Undertaker & a brain damaged Terry Gordy is better a match with The Undertaker & Vader then that is what you call disappointing. Undertaker chockslammed The Referee after the match then yelled something to McMahon.Perro AguauoCanck& Hector GarzaDefPureza GurreraHeavy Metal& Jerry Estrada** & half starsSorry if I misspelled the names. A decent little match I guarantee you that McMahon brought in foriegn talent to compete with WCW. In the back they show where Ahmed Johnson & Faarooq were on The Superstar Line.Royal Rumble MatchStone Cold Steve Austin  won when he threw Bret Hart over the top rope *** & half starsalso involvingCrushAhmed JohnsonFake Razor RamonPhinnes GodwinBart GunnPerroThe SultanMil MascarsHunter Hearst HelmsleyOwen HartGoldustBrendikoMarc MeroLatin LoverFaarooqSavio VegaJesse JamesJerry LawlerFake DieselTerry FunkRocky MiaviaMankindFlash FunkBig Van Vader Henry Godwin& The UndertakerThe Referee's were breaking up a fight between Mankind & Terry Funk. Bret Hart had thrown Steve Austin over the top rope but The Referee's didn't see it Austin went back in & threw Bret Hart over the top rope. This wasn't as great as The Rumble from the year before. You had too many guys that nobody believed was going to win plus Austin winning didn't mean much when his victory was overturned. Bret Hart cussed out Mr McMahon after the match.WWF ChampionshipShawn Michaels with Jose Lathero Def Champion Sycho Sid *** & quarter of a star a good match to win The WWF title for a 2nd timeAfter 3 Pay Per Views Buried Alive that was actually pretty good. Survivor Series which was awesome & IYH It's Time a good show. You had a PPV that was suppose to be big ending up to be lackluster. Your 2 big matches Ahmed Johnson vs Faarooq ended up being a bad match & not & going to a DQ finish. Undertaker & Vader in an average match. You had a very good Royal Rumble but in the end didn't mean much. The WWF title match with Shawn Michaels & Sid was good but overall just an average show that you just need to see the last 2 matches.Here is the problem according to The 1997 Kayfabe Commentaries Timeline 1997 with Jim Cornette he said that they were banking on Shawn Michaels hometown & the cheap tickets so they could get the type of crowd they got back in the 80's instead of how it is now a fly in like it is now with Wrestlemnaia. So I agree with the opinion that you had a big dome stadium that needed a show instead of show that needed a big dome stadium. While they drew over 60,000 people with the live gate of $480,000 this was 1 of Vince McMahon's missteps in early 1997.
summary: A stadium that needed a show. 5.5/10
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1997 VHS

reviewText: I can tell you first hand that I rented this a long time ago and let me tell you, it's one of best tapes of 1997(second to the SS 1997 tape) wrestling-wise. The Royal Rumble match itself was pretty entertaining and the World title match between HBK & Sid was not great but pretty hardcore. The rest was ok. I give this PPV a 10 out of 10.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1997 VHS

reviewText: PPV Name-Royal Rumble 10Date-1/19/97Buyrate- 0.40Attendance-60,500City - San Antonio, TexasArena - Alamo DomeShawn Michael beat Sid to win the World TitleHunter Hearst Helmsley beat Goldust to keep the IC TitleAhmed Johnson beat FaarooqVader beat the UndertakerPerro Aguayo, Hector Garza and Canak beat Guerrero, Heavy Metal and Jerry EstradaFree For All: Mascarita Sagrada and La Parkita over Mini Mankind and Mini Vader in a midget matchSteve Austin won the Royal Rumble
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1997 VHS

reviewText: As an "on-and-off" fan of professional wrestling for the past two decades, I have seen the business at its best (Hulk Hogan, Stone Cold, The Rock) and at its worst...the mid-1990s when this event was produced.  At least, however, this tape showed a glimmer of hope for the end of the decade and the beginning of the next.As far as the preliminary matches are concerned, they are basically a joke.  The Nation of Domination was one of the dumbest concepts ever implemented in the WWE, Sid Justice/Sid Vicious/Psycho Sid (just pick a name already!) is a terribly one-dimensional heel, and Shawn Michaels (though a fan favorite) had already seen his storyline peak after an epic match with Bret Hart at the previous Wrestlemania.For the Rumble itself, it is by and large just as boring as the previous edition, one of the worst in company history.  All but about 6-7 slots are filled with jobbers, fat guys, or just plain boring schmucks (whether through personality or failed "kayfabe").  When the WWE allows a pot-bellied Jake "The Snake" Roberts to still "compete", you know they are desperate for talent, seeing as how the WCW was on top of its game at the time.Yet, there also was a glimmer of hope shining through the dredge.  Characters such as "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, Rocky "The Rock" Miavia, Mankind, and Hunter Hearst Helmsley (shortly thereafter re-branded "Triple H") were just coming into their ring personas, a stable of talent that would ultimately vault the WWE past the WCW once more.  Plus, though just beginning his heel turn, Bret Hart was still a top-tier talent in the business, as was The Undertaker.Thus, although this tape is quite boring and not at all exciting in its own right, it does offer some promising steps forward for a corporation that had reached rock bottom.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1997 VHS
